definition: important news story/headline
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to demand/to request/to coerce
surname Wen
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at

sentences.english: "People's Daily" in the News twice in the version of cultural version of the presentations.
sentences.chinese: 《人民日報》於先後兩次在要聞版文化版專題介紹。

sentences.english: I read the newspaper everyday and I'm up-to-date on current events.
sentences.chinese: 我每天看報紙，對時事要聞有所瞭解。

sentences.english: Sometimes the most important news is what is not happening.
sentences.chinese: 有時，真正的要聞指向的是那些不會發生的事情。

sentences.english: Our review of this week's papers is presented by the editor of The Times'.
sentences.chinese: 我們的本週報紙要聞回顧由《時代》週刊編輯主持。

sentences.english: I read the newspaper everyday and I' m up - to -day on current even.
sentences.chinese: 我每天看報紙，對時政要聞都有所瞭解。

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to listen with respectful attention/(a polite request to sb to speak)/we are all ears
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
Lianping county in Heyuan 河源[He2 yuan2], Guangdong
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to be stuck/to feel stuck
shameful performance/disgraceful situation
to keep to the subject
to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
witticism/wisecrack/sarcastic remark/double entendre
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
